text: Bottle. It pours a lightly hazed yellow color with a small white head. The aroma is bready with nice lemongrass hops. Hints of citrus and herbs. Crackery pale malts. The flavor is bready with lightly spicy hops. Lemongrass and hints of citrus. Light bodied and pretty clean. Lightly soapy in the finish. Very nice.

Aroma - a nice malt quality with some spiced hops.
Appearance - body is a pale yellow, the head starts bubbly about 2" falls and slowly falls to a sliver of foam. There is some dappled lacing.
Taste - is clean and refreshing, with just a bit of bitterness. The malts and hops are very subtle and very well balanced. Classically pilsener. It doesnt have the grassy quality some poor pilseners have. Nice zesty quality about the bitters.
Palate - the body is light, the texture thin, the carbonation lively, and the finish is just a tease of zesty bitterness. Very enjoyable.

Very nice example of the variety.

Yellow color with a fizzy white head. Light cracker nose with some herbal and citrus notes. This is a clean, crisp lager with cracker and bread crust notes with a bit of lemon cookie and herbal hop. Dry, clean finish. Nice easy drinking beer.

UPDATED: NOV 9, 2015 cloudy light yellow, creamy head-looks delicious. aroma is big yeast, bread, honeycomb, hay, and a different, slightly tangy? fruity hop-hard to describe. flavor is full bodied bread, yeast and honey with great mild but fruity/herbally hop presence-very well balanced-many flavors working together--smooth creamy palate-excellent--and neat that they change the hops each year...

12oz bottle, thanks to jstax. Hazy golden color, with some fine particles in the body. Good finger of white head. Great ridges of lace. Nice bready dough, floral hop. Very mild pepper. Just a bit of strange yeastiness. Medium body. Great, full feel to the texture. Smooth, kind of creamy lighter carbonation, with a good dry finish. Light to moderate bitter taste, mild sweet, mild dry. Very refreshing and easy-drinking. Great stuff.

Pours a medium gold. Clear poured off the yeast. Im thinking this is from2013 cant read the b b date but I see lots of 3 s. Creamy head. Crackery sweet buttery dyacetal. Lemon herbal spice hop. Soft bready malt. Lemon grassy hop. Bile like puky bitter. Some offness old or poorly stored.

12 ounce bottle poured into a brandy snifter. The beer is a hazy yellow color with a white head of foam. The aroma is lightly grainy and yeasty. Medium floral sweetness. The taste is a touch bitter and a little bready. Lighter body and medium carbonation.

Bottle from variety pack. Poured yellow with an abundance of white foam spewing over he glass. Aroma of piss, funk, wheat, citrus, hops and spice. Initially, flavor is of banana, clove and malt. Turns to hops, spice and pine tree. Nice stuff.
Slightly hazy , deep golden color. Aroma of malt and herbs. Grassy , malty taste with some bread notes. Crispy , light , refreshing . Great beer!
This is a lighter beer. Somewhat malty. Well balanced. Smooth finish. Delightful.
on tap at Growler and Gill in Nanuet, NY; gold color; brght, citrusy, floral hop aroma; clean, bitter, floral hops on a soft, light malt base; well balanced
Very thin head, minimal lacing, crisp clear straw color. Primordial, funky aroma. Sharp, slightly bitter flavor. Little malt. Wouldnt buy again.

Aroma skunky, 
Appearance golden, hazy, cloudy, white foam, 
Taste light sweetness, lightly bitter, 
Palate light body, oily feel, flat, 
Overall I would not suggest this beer to a friend.
Clouded yellow pour with a white head. Aroma is earthy hops, malty. Taste is earthy hops, little spicy. Malt backbone. Little dry. Crisp. Hop aftertaste. Soapy lacing.

This style isnt very exciting at the best of times.. But this is a well made beer for the style. Pours a straw color with aromas of wet grain and grassy notes. Flavors are grain driven with some tart and banana pie notes. Nice.

12oz bottle pours a very hazy, bright straw gold with some ringing white head. Nose has some malt sweetness, mild candy, some straw, lemon. Flavor is quite lemony, malty sweet, straw, yeast. Lightly grassy finish. To style.

UPDATED: MAY 17, 2015 12 oz. brown bottle into a foothills glass
A: Dull hazy amber orange color. Like apple cider. No clarity. Minimal off white foamy head. Not much carbonation visible. A bit of lace as drunk.

S: Sourdough bread and fruity hop scent. Nice.

T: Snappy bitterness from the hop giving way to a very good balance with the malty sweetness toward the end. Finishes bitter but clean. Malt more evident as the brew warms. Quite good and highly drinkable.

M: Light but not watery. More carb tingle than is visible which I like. Kind of cardboardy with a stiffness and the most minimal stickiness. I like this a lot.

O: Keller Pils is a pleasant surprise. Especially since, unless I misread the stamp, this beer appears to be pretty damned old but my fault for not seeing that in store. This is good enough IMO to buy regularly but at $10/6, I likely wont revist it very often. It is very good though.

Retry on 05/17/15
Paler color, livelier carbonation, biscuity smell, a bit more yeast/grain in the taste and a velvety mouthfeel elevate this years keller pils slightly. 
Still excellent overall.
A very good grassy hoppy pils with clean crisp biscuity malt character. High drinkability, high flavor. Not the absolute best lager Ive had this year but definitely one of the better ones.
Pours a straw yellow with medium white head. Aroma and flavor matches well of lightly toasted malt and grassy hops, with a light finish.
(bottle) hazy yellow colour with a small white head; aroma of noble hops, honey; balanced flavour with a long medium bitter finish

(bottle - 12 oz) Clear gold with a white head. Light and semi-sweet aroma. Good amount of malts with some grassy hops underneath. Flavor is much the same. Not overly sweet but nicely balanced with some good grassy and floral hops. Very lightly bitter aftertaste.

12oz bottle from Total Wine in Chesapeake, V.A. compliments of Zizzybalubba. Golden hue, murky clarity with almost completely diminishing white head. No lacing. Sweet fruity aroma, spice, light citrus as warms. Light bitter fruity taste up front with a light spice finish. Soft carbonation, wet on the palate.

Bottle (brewed in Pittston, PA -- by Susquehanna Brewing Co?).

Head is initially average sized, frothy, white, mostly diminishing.
Body is hazy light yellow.

Aroma is lightly to moderately malty (toasted bread/grain), lightly to moderately hoppy (herbs, flowers), lightly to moderately yeasty (dough), with light notes of minerals and sulfur.

Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter.
Finish is lightly to moderately sweet, lightly acidic, lightly to moderately bitter.

Medium body, watery/syrupy texture, lively carbonation, lightly alcoholic.

Other than the doughy yeast note, the nose is actually quite evocative of Franconian pils, so it deserves some props for that. Sadly, it doesnt hold up in the mouth experience, being pretty flabby/syrupy and overly sweet. Some more attention to detail on this one might be able to turn this into a winner.

Bottle, thanks bill! Pours hazy butterscotch, medium fizzy off white head that mostly dissipates to a ring and a film. Nice lacing though. Aroma is grain, grass, some biscuit. Flavor is light sweet, light bitter, not metallic. A bit of something sweet, hard to place. Overall very clean. Light body, prickly carbonation. Not bad at all for style. Refreshing after yard work.
Tap light golden pour. Sweet, floral, bread. Light body. Refreshing. Easy to drink
Bottle. Cloudy yellow beer with a light head. Lager yeast aroma, medium body with bitter finish that lingers. Overall a flavorful pilsener.

12 oz. bottle from Total Wine, Chesapeake, VA. Hazy yellowish-orange pour with a foamy white head. Aroma of tangerine and Earth. Taste is good but the citrus is much more subdued than anticipated from the aroma. This is not what I expected as a pilsener. Pretty good overall.

Bottle poured a lighter golden color with a cap of white head. Aroma has sweet malt, grain touches, and a bit of hops. Mouth feel is medium light with medium low carbonation. Flavor follows suit, pilsner malt, mild lemon, grains, and bits of hops.
Pours hazy yellow, aroma is spicy noble hops that is really nice. Taste is crisp and a slight bitter finish, really awesome
Bottle. Pours a golden color with white head. Yeasty, sweet bread, dough, slight citrus aromas. Sweet doughy, yet slightly bitter, yeasty flavors. Pretty good.
Pour is hazy yellow with a small white head. Aroma and flavor are lightly sweet with notes of biscuit, grass, toasted grains, honey, and orange tang.
3/10/2013. From bottle. Hazy pale yellow with a white head. Fruity aromas with hint of citrus. Malty flavors, fruits and hops show well. Very refreshing.
Pours a light yellow. Has a nice citrus and wheat aroma. A sweet oils to start with some citrus and then a light mix of spices, grass and malt to finish.
12oz bottle. Sweet authentic brewhouse Boho aroma. Hazy unfiltered orange-tan aroma. Steady creamy white head. Smooth and creamy medium body. A solid example of a Keller Pils.
Aroma is yeast, grainy malts, grass and mild fruit. The flavor is grainy malts, fruit, grassy hops and a beery finish.
Bottle. Light lactic lemon malt aroma. Hazy golden yellow with giant head. Lemon malt and dry, bitter hay flavor. Nice - dry and hoppy for the style.
Bottle. Bready barley malt and hay aroma. Hazy golden yellow with a moderate white head. Sweet barley malt and grassy hops flavor. Medium creamy body, soft carbonation. Very nice.
Outstanding mixtue of hops in the taste, long dry finish with notes of liquor and wood. Good dark color, a bit hazy, small head and lace. Weak aroma.

Pours a carbonated hazy golden yellow from the bottle with no real head or lacing. Aroma is nice bready grain and pils malt. Taste follows, clean and crisp. Pairs nicely with a big burley cheese, but otherwise just an easy drinker.

12 ounce bottle into lager glass, no bottle dating. Pours moderately hazy golden straw color with a 1-2 finger dense and fluffy white head with fantastic retention, that reduces to a nice cap that linger. Light spotty soapy lacing clings down the glass, with plenty of streaming carbonation retaining the head. Aromas of lemon, pear, apple, grape, floral, grass, light pepper, cracker, bread, light honey, and herbal/yeast earthiness. Very nice aromas with good balance of malt, hop, and yeast ester notes; with good strength. Taste of lemon, pear, apple, grape, floral, grass, biscuit, light honey, light pepper, and herbal/yeast earthiness. Slight earthy bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of light fruits, floral, grass, biscuit, light honey, light pepper, and herbal/yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Very nice balance of malt, hop, and yeast ester flavors; with nice flavor robustness and no cloying flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth and lightly crisp mouthfeel that is good. Alcohol is very well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish. Overall this is a damn nice unfiltered pilsner style! All around nice balance of flavors; and very smooth to drink. A very enjoyable offering.
Hands-down the best pils Ive ever had - everything about this beer was just what I wanted - bright and drinkable - light and refreshing. Fantastic.

Bottle. Pours lightly hazy yellow with a medium, frothy white head, short retention with good lacing. Aroma is spicy and earthy hops with Pils malt. Flavor is moderate hops and bitterness with supporting malt and a dry finish. Light body and medium carbonation.

Southampton Keller Pils. Serving: 12 oz. bottle from Total Wine Sterling. It pours a hazy light gold with a sustained, soft white head. The nose has a bit of yeast, grass, and biscuit. Nice depth of flavor with a slightly bready and cracker notes. Nice grassy bitterness. Light to medium body with a medium finish. An outstanding pils.

Bottle into a goblet. Nice golden hay pour with a thick white head that leaves moderate lacing. Floral, grainy, grassy aroma. Taste is nice and doughy, cracker, floral, grass. Thick almost chewy, but in a good way. Smooth, lightly crisp finish. Pretty nice!

UPDATED: AUG 26, 2013 Bottle, I think the date is 04/13. Effervescent and lightly hazed gold with a soft white head. Baked biscuit and doughy pilsner malt nose with a very Bavarian minerallic character, calcium, phosphorus, chalk, etc. Lemony and floral German hop aroma and flavor, perhaps a bit too raw / green from the hops in the finish but thats a minor complaint. Medium to light bodied with soft malt, creamy carbonation, lightly sweet and a bit chewy late. Otherwise its fantastic, very clean, nicely balanced and all ingredients seem well expressed. Kudos for this beer existing.
Hazy golden color with white head. Nice berry fruit, spicy, pils malt aromas. Medium body. Nice dry cracker malt flavors with crisp bitter hoppage---drying finish----good
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text:
bottle purchased at Total Wine in Springfield, VA July 2013
Pours lightly hazy bright orange with a small fizzy white head. nose is mostly of toasted grains, pale malt husks, lite grassy notes, but mostly husky. not very much hops here. im not very educated on this style of beer however, it does remind me of new glarus zwickel quiet a bit in its grainy notes and lite sweetness. body is crisp and full yet refreshing. long pale grain husky finish, which is clean and pleasant. very solid beer here.

Appearance:
Golden cereal grains and orange with a light haze. The white head fades into a thin white collar surrounding a broken layer of white.

Nose:
Herbal, bready, yeasty, and orangey with the bitter zest of orange skin in the back. Freshly baked whole grain breads still slightly warm to the touch with a golden brown crust. Wheat grass. Dried herbs in the bread.

Palate:
Bready, yeasty, grassy, nutty, whole grain seeds and cereal grains, and wheat grass. Chewy mouthfeel thanks to being unfiltered, hence the light haze. Bitter bite in the back of dried grass and herbs. Finishes dry, thirst quenching, and thirst inducing. Table crackers and toast underneath for support and some crisp crunch.

Final Thoughts:
Brilliantly balanced flavorful Keller Pils from the genius brewers at Southampton Publick House. Southampton brews clean beers that are perfectly to style without being boring or underwhelming. In fact, they are over-achievers, raising the bar for other brewers who dare to brew in the same vein. Delicious.

(An original written work by Beer Ambassador, LLC. Plagiarism is not tolerated.)

Bottle. Pours a hazy dark golden color with a smallish white head on it. Nose is nice a light, with the sweetness of a lager aroma and just a hint at some citrus in there. Taste is crisp and ever-so-slightly sweet as well. Very easy summer drink with just a hint at some citrus.

Orangey hazy pour. Some white head. Aroma of beans, honey, wheat and barley. Sweet boozy flavor like a barleywine. Some tart mouthfeel and some soft particles smoothing it out. A very nice level of effervescence. Seems higher than 5% because of how big in flavor it is with a slight alcohol burn.

Bottle at home. Also had this on tapas BCTC several years back. This is a really solid unfiltered pils that I am psyched is to see on the shelves around here. Grassy, biscuit malts, very little graininess, very clean and bright.

Bottle from Sams Quik Shop in Durham. Nice to see these beers again. Pale straw gold with a white head. Nose is a bit soapy and floral at first, but then more subtle aromas emerge, including fresh croissants and a hint of almond paste. Taste adds grassy bitter notes. Solid.
bottle. Golden with small head. Surprisingly flavorful for a pilsner. Mild, but quite exceptional.
beer does some decent lifting. bigger body than jabby brau, if that is where i am @. pleasant cracker malts. some juiciness. nice wet hay and grass hops. tasty.

Bottle. Gold pour, big white head, excellent retention/lace. Aroma of cereal grains and light grassy hops. Taste is big lager yeast, lightly bitter grassy/floral noble hops, sourdough bread. Palate is soft, creamy, quenching, light bitter finish. Very good.

Clean, bitter, and complex, it could use a bit more aroma but pleasurable to have. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours very cloudy yellow with a minimal white head.
Aroma is sweet....citrus and grass.
Flavour is strongly hay, bread....tingly carbonation.
Grassy, herbal, hay flavoured hop bittering.
Very good.

Bottle: &nbsp Golden, miniscule haze, moderate frothy white head, fairly nice lacing. &nbsp Sweet straw/hay on the nose. &nbsp Subtle hop. &nbsp Very much straw and hay on the tongue, light sweetness, with a lingering hop 

presense. &nbsp Body and mouthfeel are moderate to full, for a Pils. &nbsp Nice soft sweet hay and grass finish, with a bite of a hop bite. &nbsp Clean, refreshing, and overall very enjoyable. &nbsp This crept up on me, kept drinking it 

and before I realized it the damn thing was almost gone. &nbsp Good stuff.

Pours a light yellow with a boozy head and medium carbonation. Aromas of herbal/lightly fruity hops, hay, and light toffee. Flavors of mono-toned herbal/grassy hops and a little hay. Aftertaste comes off light a light soap (not my cup), lightly dry, and just a tad bit of a grassy finish.
Nice coudy yelow pour with a decent head and small lacing. Very hoppy up front taste and lingers on palate. It is a good representation of the style.

Bottle.  Pours hazy gold with a medium, white head.  Grassy and light bread aromas with some earthy and spicy hops.  Grassy and light bread flavors with hints of citrus and spicy/earthy hops.  Similar smooth finish with some added floral notes.  Very tasty for the style.
Golden in color, clear with a thin head.  Easy drinking pils with good amount of hops added.

Bottle. Pours hazed gold with a medium, foamy white head. Aroma is grassy and grainy with soft floral hops, toasted malt and soft spicy hops. Taste is grassy with toasted grains, biscuit malt, light bread dough, soft spicy hops and honey-lemon. Body is medium and crisp with a soft, creamy carbonation. Ends with more toasted grains, sweet malt, biscuit, grass, floral hops and light spicy hops.Tasty pilsener!

Pours a hazy yellow-orange with minimal head.  Aroma is malty, lightly sweet, with subtle hop spice.  Flavor of biscuit and grass, crisp, dry, and lightly spicy and bitter on the finish.  A well made pilsener.
A strict traditional German style brew. I would enjoy it more if I was drinking it in Hamburg, and not in Oregon, and if it was brewed in Bavaria, not New York.

yellow, aroma is a little skunky. sweetness gives way to spicy bitterness. bitterness does not last long, providing nice flavor but crisp. very enjoyable. could drink many. judging by the look and smell, im guessing this one isnt as fresh as it could be. definitely will have to get another one time comes summer
This was a very light beer with a grassy taste and aroma. Not all that great.

Ugly, murky yellow pour with no head. Small chunks of yeast look sand in mybeer. Luckily everything else is excellent. Lemony and grassy aroma. Texture is smooth and creamy. Grassy and tangy hop flavors and solid malt back bone.  Very nice.

Strong, malty aroma has a decided yeasty overtone. Pours a bubbly clear yellow with a fairly thick ivory head. Crisp, refreshing fruity has good malty, fruity and yeasty notes, a grassy hop bitter undertone, maybe nothing special but definitely enjoyable. Smooth texture lacks firmness, and fizz leaves something to be desired. Still a decent pilsner.

Pours a slightly hazy pale yellow with a medium white head.  Aroma has grass and sweet straw notes.    Flavor is spicy/grassy with good bitterness...some light cereal.  Mouthfeel is light/medium with a nice bitter, dry finish.

Southampton Keller Pils has a medium, off-white head, some lacing, and a cloudy, bubbly, golden appearance. The aroma is of dank, musty, sugary grain, and the flavor is very hoppy, with a gentle bitterness. One will pick up medium-roasted malt, hay, grass, sugar, and even lemon with this beer. Mouthfeel is medium, and Southampton Keller Pils finishes crisp, clean, refreshing, mostly dry, and highly drinkable. A sure winner, which I unquestionably recommend! RJT

12 oz single bottle from "Lifesource" in Salem OR.
$1.39
Poured into my PRB "chalice" it is a bright golden,slightly hazy pils ( seemed to be some yeast in the bottom as i poured..nice quarter inch sized white head.
Good malty,biscuity aroma with a hint of Saaz type hop
Taste is very nicely malted with a touch again of saaz type hopping, very balanced also getting some spiciness and yeasts showing through..like a regular pils mixed with a light hefeweizen..nice
Good palate, very enticing .
Excellent beer..would be terrific in the late Spring.

Aroma: soft, soapy hop noes, light skunk, hop backing.Sweet golden malts. 
 Look: neat, fine hazeon gold bottom with medium plus top. Rocky lace shown. 4- 
Taste: medum light bodied. Golden malts with softnes of unfiltered body. Clean gentle hop profile. Herbal notes. Neat. Quiet gentle sample. Solid.
Decent brew from the East End. Not bad for a place owned by Pabst. Clear yellow color, decent head with a good pour. Kinda reminds me of Sam Adams Noble Pils

Half a pint on tap at Prohibition Pig.
Appearance : Clear yellow with small head.

Aroma : Nice malt with light citrusy notes. Slightly peppery. 

Taste : Nice malt with citrusy and fruity notes. Finish slightly yeasty with malt and spicy hops. Peppery on the finish. 

Overall : Not as clean as it could be but still pretty tasty. Nicely refreshing with a nice malty finish. Highly drinkable. Coudl get a few more points by being crisper and sharper but very decent as is.

My Bottom Line :  
Peppery, herbal hops spice up this quite malty lager, bready flavors enveloping most of the mild hop bitterness.

Further Personal Perceptions :  
-A veil of foam covers the misty gold.
-This is sweeter than the Mahrs Pils I had next to it. I expected something crisper, I presume.
-The prickly carbonation helped pierce the doughy maltiness.
-Light citrus was shared by the hops.

On tap at Prohibition Pig.

Bottle. This pours a golden color with a thin white head. Bread, corn, and some hay in the scent. The flavors are crisp and clean; sweet bready notes, grain, corn, grass, and a dry hoppy finish. No thrills; just tasty and easy drinking. Good Pils.

Bottled. Pours hazy pale orange with a short white head. Decent retention and lace. Aromatic floral hop and pilsner malt nose and palate. Light-med body, average carbonation, prickly-creamy texture, and a dry, light hop finish. Nice beer.
Bottle. Pours hazy yellow with a thick white head and tons of carbonation. The aroma has spicy hops with a good bit of pils malt. Great taste here with a big hop punch up front with a dry finish.

Draught at Baileys Taproom, Portland. Cut grass aroma with some Saaz-like notes.Hazy golden straw color, heavy carb, creamy white head. Mild malt sweetness in initial; a bit of sourness emerges in mid palate; mild bitter finish.Thin body. Lots of concentrated carbonation in mid and final, which sort of creates a muddy mess in the mouth. But works okay. Good light stuff.

Sampled from a 12 oz brown bottle this beer poured a cloudy yellow color with a large foamy yellow-white head that lingered and left a bit of lacing. The aroma was sour, tangy, perfumey and floral with a faint note of citrus. The flavor was dryish and nutty with notes of Pez candies, citrus, perfume and had a bitter bite. The finish was medium length sour and tangy citrus and Pez. Light to medium body. Eh.

Keg @ Pony Bar UES. Pours a light golden color with an attractive white head. The nose is light lemon, spicy hops, and a bit of granary bread. The taste is simple, light peppery hops, some lemon. Thats about it. Refreshing light body, a bit fizzy. Solid pils.

Bottle.  Poured a slightly cloudy, golden color,  Medium full head that stood for awhile then slowy dissipated.  Floral, grass, hay hop aroma, slight lemon.  Light bitterness.  Light bodied.  Ave carbonation. Slight pine taste.  Has a funky heinekin or stella kind of taste to it.

first off, fuck garmin and untappd, both fuckin suck and waste my time! .. first beer on Canadian soil . bought at Village Beer in Buffalo after Pearl Street and Blue Monk .. pours gold .. light foam .. grain and hay, nice mouthfeel .. refreshing, drinking this in my hotel room .. . . is that a high wire walker??

12 ounce bottle thanks to Dallas. Pours a clear yellow color with a small white head. The aroma is light corn and malts, some spices. The flavor is a nice easy Pils with a big spicy hop and earthy sweet dry malts.

2012 bottle from Beers of the World. Cloudy gold with a low head. Nice malty nose, light hops. Full, rich malt flavor, great hop characternoble hop flavor with loight lemon. Very creamy and full body. Soft bitterness. An excellent kellerbier, very authentic. One of the better Ive had from the US.

12oz bottle shared by Dallas 
Appearance: Cloudy yellow with a big white head and good lacing. Aroma and tastes of pils malts, honey and grainy. A nice light pilsner, tasty
Poured from a 12 ounce bottle. This is a fantastic pilsner. Spicy hop character, sweet pilsner malt, nice and grainy. Very clear.
Draft at Queens Kickshaw. Skunky lemon hop, yellowish body, white head. Pretty traditional looking Pils, but hoppier, funkier body. Heavy, OK.

12 oz. bottle, pours a hazy golden with a tiny white head. Aroma of very dry grassy hops, some wet horse blanket, fresh baked bread and some yeast. Flavour of dried grassy hops, freshly baked bread, and some yeasty notes. Finishes on the dry hoppy, bready notes. Very refreshing and well-brewed pilsner.

12 oz. bottle from Secret Santa.  Thanks man!  Pours a hazy straw yellow color with touches of orange.  Aroma of fresh baked bread, mild yeast.  Some earth, green hops, mild yeast.  Flavor is yeasty, nice fresh baked bread and dough flavors.  Present, medium bitter hops.  Finishes nice and hoppy.  A lovely beer that I wish I had access to on the regular.
Hazy pour with a medium white head. Corn flake aroma, clean. Grassy hops, crisp, easy drinker.
Poured hazy yellow with a smallish head. Faint aroma of grass and some spices. There is a little thirst quenching bitterness with a smooth finish. A well made beer, but not a favorite for me.

Pours a cloudy, hazy straw yellow with floaties in it.  The head was initially large, but faded to a ring in seconds.  Aroma of straw, citrus, sunshine.  Perhaps a little yeast.  The taste feels very authentic... As if this is a home brew from a small town in Germany.  Noble hops, light malts.  Dry finish.  Im very impressed by this beer.  Excellent and deserving of its high style rating.  Should this perhaps be classified as a kellerbier?
Bottle.  Light bodied but VERY tasty. Aroma faint out of the bottle, but improved as beer warmed. Hazy yellow with a thin white head.  Endless finish.  Good after a hot days work.
user_location: Munchen an der Willamette, Oregon, USA

text: Hazy gold, slight head around rim, aroma is of malt (wheat) and faint hops (typical of style); flavor is the high point- crisp citrusy wheaty/grainy smooth and refreshing and then finishes dry and bitter for a long time! Hell-yeah I like it!!!!!

Pours a hazy yellow with white head and active carbonation. Aroma is pils malt mixed with an earthy note. Taste is sweet but simultaneously bitter. The bitterness is light and floral in tone. This beer finishes with a deeper darker biterness that tends to linger.

Bottle @ The BeerMongers...  Poured pale, golden/yellow with a fizzy white head.  Nice drinking pils. Grassy floral, hoppy, medium bitterness, nice malt presence that didnt linger. Clean, quick finish.  Herbal, minty, lemon, wheaty. Solid beer.
Bottle. Pours a clear, bright yellowish color. Lots of carbonation. Malts but sweet. One of the best Pilseners Ive had. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12oz bottle pours hazy yellow with a white head and that unfiltered look.  Aromas of straw wheat cereals and pale malts. Flavor is kinda sour with some bitter flavors.   Body is medium light and finishes with some funk.
Very nice flavored Pils - enjoy the unfiltered distinction, and this Pils really has a nice palate - I could use even more hops but Im not complaining.  A great alternative in the Pils category.
Pours gold with a white head.  Aroma is florals, grass and a hint of citrus.  Taste is crisp bitters with a touch of sweetness. Good carbonation gave rhis a lively finish.

Straw yellow with tons of carbonation, small head with fair retention. Nose of grass and faint pepper, abit of cracker. Taste is bitter but crisp. Hop flavor dominates, especially the grass. Enjoyable, just a no bs pils.

Bottle. Slightly hazy yellow, very rocky head with little retention. The aroma is  soap, grass, and fresh wet dough. It has a solid medium body, and a smooth and creamy carbonation level. Fairly sweet for a pils with strong honey and orange notes on the front. Finishes bitter and crisp, with a lingering tanginess. Really nice pilsener.
Orange-y gold in color, with a small, white head.  Crisp and refreshing, with a moderate hop bite. Some biscuit and fruit notes.

On sample at southampton publick house.
Better than the regular lager. Not a lt of taste but nice malty taste.
Draft at Pony with Sean. Pours an amber golden body. Aroma and flavor have notes of me not taking notes. pils, hop, blaaaah

Shaker pint draft at the brew pub in Southampton, New York.  The pour is mostly clear golden, with a one inch foamy head that leaves nice lacing behind.  The aroma is toast along with a touch of floral and maybe a hint of some spice yeast in the back.   The taste is sharp with cracker malt, the warm toast of the nose, floral hops, a touch of diacetyl, and then finishes with the spice yeast.  As it warms, there is also a decent blast of peach fruit sweetness.  The palate is medium to light bodied, active carbonation and unfiltered mouth feel.  Nice.

Aroma is fresh and citrucy with a gold appearance with diminishing lacey head. A bit hoppier than expected. Aftertaste gives a bitter feel that doesnt  linger. Overall its a pretty good pilsner and it looks more refreshing than it tastes but i would say its worth a one time six pack buy. One time.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from brewolf...thanks Michael! - Pours hazy yellow with tons of cascading bubbles that rise up to a foamy white head. Sweet honey malt with a lightly sour graininess. Light herbal hopping. Has an...I dont know...creaminess to the nose. Luscious. Taste begins with a blast of the graininess I smelled in the nose, then transitions into bit of mineral wateriness blended with a sharp grassy hop note. Honey comes in strong on the finish, mixing with the hops and a bit of spiciness. Quenching, but the hops bite a bit too much for my tastes in this style. Has a body unlike any beer Ive had before--fine-bubbled velvet, with a big full mouthfeel. This is excellent.

Hazy, honey-gold pour topped by a nice ring of thin white foam.  Nose is chamomile-like flowers, dried lemons, and wholesome grain.  Flavor is lightly bready with yeasty notes of honeyed malt.  Body is light, and the soft carbonation makes it creamy smooth on the palate.  Fresh sweet-grass and dried flowers cling to a subtle doughy quality which leads to a lightly bitter and lingering finish.  Honest, wholesome, drinkable, and thoroughly enjoyable.  This is just my kind of beer right now.
Hazed yellow pour with no head or lace. Pepper and dry malt. Sweet caramel malt, pepper, and a nice medium bitter. Medium bodied but fizzy.

Tap at SPH. Pours clear straw to almost green with big carbonation. Larger, suddy white head. Thicker, sticky lace. Nose is macro lager grain and white sugar. Taste is very soapy and crisp grassy pils hoppy. Nice quenching palate. Reminds me Victorys pilseners. Quenching biscuity malt and long, bitter grassy finish. Very addicting. Lets work on some aromatic hops in the nose. Still very good. Love this session beer. Would be a 3.7 easily without the poor aroma.
Pour a clear vibrant yellow with little lacing.  Clean crisp light malt notes with hints of cereal grain i.e plain cheerios.
Grass and hay in the aroma.  Flavor starts malty with a little grape, then closes with some nice hop bitterness.  Really good.

Date: August 17, 2010
Mode: Draft
Source: Mac McGees
Appearance: hazy pale yellow, creamy white head, lots of sticky lace
Aroma: dry spicy cereal aroma
Flavor: dry cereal flavor, big crisp hops, lots of spicyness, light bitterness, long bitter finish
Overall: a damn fine pils
Aroma: 6/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 6/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 13/20
Rating: 3.2/5.0Drinkability: 8/10
Score: **+ /4

Bottle from Good Beer NYC.
Pours hazy golden with a shortlasting head.
Aroma of green apples and grass.
Bitter tasting, more hops than barley.

Bottle from Half Time. Pours lightly hazy gold with a slight white head. Aroma of pale malt, citrus and grassy hop. Med body. Flavor is slightly grapey and pretty grassy. It gets a bit more grapey with time. Finishes on the bitter side. Very nice.

Bottle, thanks to Rastacouere. Pour a light slightly hazy gold with a finger of white foam which quickly recedes to a thin veil before completely disappearing. Aroma is very nice, peaches, apricots, grain and spicy hops all mingle well. Taste is light and grainy, slight honey flavor with a crisp hop finish. Body is light and fluffy, good carbonation and well balanced after-taste. Id make this a regular if I could!rrrr
Aroma is very fragrant grassy,  lemon zest.  Earthy, lemon, coriander taste.  Very crisp.

I have had some fantastic Keller Pilseners in Franconia but I still want to give American Brewers a chance because I ove the style and want to find a comparable brew in the US to the Franconian lagers.

This one pours a bit hazier of a color than most keller plseners. Even though they all are unfiltered the German ones seem to prefer a pale brightness that I dont get with this beer. It is a monotonous almost whiteish gold.

The smell is more on par with a true kellerbier. It is grassy with some lime and a nice mineral water/malt body.

The flavor is pretty nice as well, doesnt hold up to the Franconian beers but as a US beer we have a winner. Nice and bitter with an herbal, grassy bite, but a balance of pilsener malt and a nice water character.

Hats of to these guys for producing a quality lager unlike a majority of craft brewers.

Slightly hazy golden coloured body with a thinnish white head. Aroma of fresh malt, light citrus, some coriander seed and a nice herbal and grassy freshness. Light-bodied; Pungent malt flavour at first with some grassy hop notes, a bit of a herbal, drying character and a good bitter finish. Aftertaste shows a good robust complexity with more grassy and herbal notes than anything else - but the malt and hop balance is spot on. Overall, a nice beer and a good pungent and rather complex beer for the style - even in this twelve ounce size instead of the usual 75 cL goodies from the brewery. I sampled this twelve ounce bottle purchased from Liqour Outlet in Boonton, New Jersey on 24-July-2011 for US$7.95 for a 6 pack, sampled at home in Washington on 10-September-2011.
I am shocked that this beer scored so high.  Very boring, very light.  Perhaps this is the perfect storm for a Keller Pils, I dont know.  I will pass on this one.

On tap at Issacs.

Yello / orange pour with aromas of grain, hop and spice.  The flavor was clean, mild hop with a zesty pepper bite. Good.

This was a good solid pilsner.  Im not a huge fan of the variety but I certainly appreciated this one.  If you like pilsner you should give this one a try.  Its made from unfiltered varietal hops.  I have no idea what that means but Im sure it means something to someone.  And it looks nice written on a beer label.  B-)
Tap at the Publick house.  This is a clean and crisp tasting pils.  its grassy, citrusy, floral, with light fruits.  finishes dry and quite bitter.
Crisp, a bit hoppy, and malty in a good way. Pretty good Pilsner, but nothing I would go out of my way to try again.

Cloudy appearance, nice the flavor was left in. The aroma is rich and malty for a plisner. Odd and awesome. First you get concentrated plisner Malts then a Belgian candy like taste. Subtle hops in finish. One of the best plisners.
Pours a hazy pale golden color with white head. Aroma of grasses, malts and fruit. Flavor was well balanced between the sweet, doughy malts and the grassy and slightly citrus hops. Nice session beer!
Bottle. Pours a cloudy yellow orange color, minimal head. Smells of some pine, fruit and grass. More flavor and full bodied then Id expectt from a pilsner. Really good

Hazy pale straw color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of malt, yeast, floral hops, & some fruit; Flavor of slight sweet malt, hops, grain, citrus, and spice; Finish is dry & slightly bitter; Nicely balanced; Solid pils overall - refreshing.

Pours cloudy and faint orange. Big bright aroma of sweet malts and fresh fruits, particularly orange and lemon. Hoppier then expected, featuring a nice pine twang which is an immediate plus.  Flavor has a dominate sweet pilsner malt presence that lends to a bitter and clean finish. Get lots of butterscotch notes which turn me just slightly off. Reminds me more of an English bitter. Southampton typically kills it, but this beer falls into the land of mediocrity.
Extremely drinkable and well-hopped pils.  On tap it poured nicely with some retained head.  Its a bit sweet and certainly strong, read: Americanized pilsener.
Draft. Pours golden yellow with a white head. Fresh grainy aroma, with light bready notes and some floral notes. The flavor is fresh and grainy, with earthy and floral notes. Nice. Very drinkable.
Tap.  Pours yellow with a white head.  Grassy hops, grain.  Slightly sweet, easy to drink.
Very nice. Crisp and flavorful. A lightly bitter hops finish follows grassy and citrus notes. Will try again.

UPDATED: AUG 4, 2013 Tap. Moderate grain and light bread for the malt, light grass for the hops, dough for the yeast, with a hint of cooked celery. Head is small, wispy with bigger bubbles, white with good yet thin lacing and is mostly diminishing. Color is sparkling clear pale gold. Flavor starts slightly sweet and lightly acidic, then finishes lightly acidic and bitter. Palate is light to medium, watery with a lively carbonation and finishes lightly dry. A clean, crisp Keller Beir, both tasty and refreshing.

UPDATED: OCT 19, 2011 Still nothing else to do tasting with Suttree.
Clear yellow with a thin white head.
Sweet malt aroma.
Light sweetness in the flavor with some dryness and bitterness in the finish.
Hazy yellow, white cover.  Musty aroma, light fruit.  Taste is more dusty, yeasty, sweet apple skin.

Orangey yellow, thin ring of foam. Smells a little like Cheerios, plus a little bit peppery. Clean crisp, with some peppery flavors, some fruity flavors. Lightly spicy finish. Tasty stuff. Thanks to stevo for bringing this!

12 oz bottle; big thanks to NYBeer for sending me a bunch of this; pours deep, dense gold with thin, egg shell white head fading to a thin film; fresh cut grass, dried lemons, crackery malt and stale grain; light, creamy mouthfeel goes down super easy with dried flowers and lemony grass in the finish; crisp, clean and creamy smooth; light honey, a touch of bitterness from dried hops, nuts and dried flowers; crackery pils malt, light honey and creamy dough; perfectly balanced mouthfeel and pretty much everything you want in an east drinking beer; simple, clean and flavorful; yum

Bottle, pours hazy and a dull golden orange. Nose has pepper and fresh long clippings with some sweet grain and straw. Flavors have a pleasant peppery bitterness, grassy hop notes, sweet cereal, dry honey, and grain. Pretty well done but a touch underattenuated and sweet.  Nice crisp peppery with slight mint finish, very refreshing.

Tampa Weekly Gathering @BT WesleyChapel-on tap-pours a retaining white head and hazy straw/yellow color.  Aroma is light malt-hay, some fruit.  Taste is light malt-hay, some fruit/spice hops (tettnang).

12 once bottle at the 12th Richmond Ratebeer Gathering on 9/18/10. Im not 100% sure who brought this but it surely wasnt Butters as he thought it was a totally different beer. Oy! Pours a pale straw yellow color with a thin creamy head. Decent head retention and lacing. Aroma of pale malts, some grainy notes, bread and a nice lightly grassy finish. The taste is grainy malts, apple and a grassy finish. Very dry. Medium bodied.

Bottle.  Pours a light clear glowing golden yellow with a tight frothy white foamy head.  Aroma is very grassy and lemony, touch of almond, bit tangy, round cough drop sweetness, floral.  Flavor follows, medium strong bitterness, bit of that cough drop lemony sweetness, fairly round for a pils, lightly biscuity towards the finish with some bitter chalkiness.  A little full in the body, not quite as crisp and refreshing as I would like.

12 oz bottle. Pours a glowing golden with a thick frothy white head. Aroma is very aggressive noble hop character, nice lightly stinky hops over a crisp but sweet malt base, slightly corny and quite grainy. Flavor is sweet and grainy, some breadiness and a strong grassy hop character, very earthy the hops play a nice classic pils role. Finishes crisp and clean, a slight lemon zest. Medium body and sharp carbonation. I dug this pils.

12oz poor shared by FunkyBrewster. Pours a slightly hazy golden with a white head. Has a grainy corn meal aroma with some citric undertones. Crisp floral hoppiness with a bitter finish and that cornmeal taste throughout.Not bad but a little to much corn for my taste.
10/2/10.  12oz bottle.  Sweet banana and grainy pils aroma, same in the flavor with emphasis on the grain.

From MaltDawg @ 12th Richmond Gathering. This poured a slightly cloudy yellow. Aroma is very grassy and earthy. The taste is heavy on the grassy hops, though there is also a solid malty backbone which comes through on the aftertaste. A very decent beer for the style.

Pours cloudy yellow with a mushroom cloud of whit foam that quickly dissipitated.  A biere de garde keller element with the pils, nice is you appreciate the keller.  Above average mouthfeel, good drinkability.  Good summer refreshment

Location: 12 oz bottle from Buy Rite - Jersey City, 10/7/10


Aroma: The nose has some straw, grass, and hay that goes along with a crisp, clean hop character

Appearance: It pours a cloudy golden color with a small white head and a decent amount of lace

Flavor: The taste is dough and cracker up-front followed by a crisp floral hop finish to it

Palate: The body of this one is nice, it is crisp and clean, and a little too much carbonation

Overall Impression: 
I like this one.  It has that nice crisp and enjoyable pils feel that I look for in this style.  This could be a heck of a session beer, and would probably be even better if it was a bit fresher, but it was still pretty good here.  Well-made and highly drinkable.  My one qualm, I would have preferred a bit less carbonation, it took away from the beer just a little bit.

12oz bottle.  clear straw gold under a medium, fluffy, white head.  zesty hop and lemon aroma.  flavor is clean with a gentle hop addition and a hint of sweetness in the form of honey in the finish.  medium carbonation is a plus.  refreshing.

Pale straw colour with a fairly hazy appearance.  The nose is loaded with zesty noble hop character over a very light, lean crackery pilsner malt base.  Crackery and dry with a great floral/spicy hoppiness.  Lean and very thirst quenching.  Along with Sam Adams Noble Pils  this is a great interpretation of these styles.

Draft Lightly hazed yellow lager with a small, fizzy, white head. Decent retention. The nose is doughy and bready with lesser notes of spicy and citric hops. Light to medium-bodied with lively carbonation. The flavor is doughy, but snappy, refreshing and mildly bitter overall. Crisp, lightly bitter finish.
From MaltDawg @ 12th Richmond Gathering: Mild DMS and grass aroma. Milky yellow, thin head. Grainy initially and finishes grassy. Exemplary pils, but too much so.

Golden pour with a fluffy white head.  Aroma is spicy hops, a touch of earth, crisp clean pils malt, some cracker.  lightly effervescent.  Flavor has touches of tart wheat/funky yeastiness on the edges, with the center being honey, pils malt, spicy hoppage.  Yum

woo wee!  This was a pleasant beverage, something Id like to drink a big mug of an a summer evening.  It was very light but with some funkiness that I guess would be attributed to the unfiltered yeastiness, although Ive since wondered if its other brewing techniques applied to make this odd pils a bit more interesting.  Yum, I need to get another bottle.
Sampled at the Richmond Gathering XII. Very clean, crisp, and spot on for style. Id rather have the tuppers.  But for an american brewery trying the style, this is damn good.

(Sample Date: 9/18/2010   Source:Other)   12 oz bottle. Lightly grainy, bit of skunk, light spicy fruitiness. Clear very light straw golden with small white head. Light sweet malt body with some spicy hop flavor. Medium body and mouth. Finish is medium to dry with a light noble hop residual.

Bottle courtesy of MaltDawg at the 12th Richmond Ratebeer Gathering on 09/18/2010. Clear pale golden body with a medium rocky white head. Sweet honey and pilsner malt aroma. Sweet pils malt flavor with some honey and spicy hops. Medium light body with moderate carbonation.

Brooklyn Beer and Soda ($10): Pours golden with white head. Skunky aroma coupled with hops. Dont know if this beer has been sitting too long... maybe seeing as it is a spring seasonal. In any case, it tastes fine. Vegetal aspects might be getting the best of it by now. Doughy feel to it. Very, very crisp. Exactly what I need right now considering that I have been cleaning my overly hot house all day.

12oz bottle.  If Im reading the codes correctly, this is best by Aug 30, 2010 and was bottled May 3, 2010.  Pours lightly hazy pale straw gold with a small white head.  Aroma has some citrus/lemon, also grassy, floral, and herbal with some grain.  Good strength.  Flavor is some citrus, mostly lemon, herbal and floral hops, some grainy malt, light bitterness with some fair sweetness, finishes relatively dry.  Mouthfeel is light to medium bodied, slick, medium carbonation.  Very easy drinking, crisp and refreshing, particularly considering it is 1 day from the best by date.  Will definitely nab a fresh sixer next spring!

Bottle.  Pours a hazy golden straw color with a foamy white head.  Nose is sweet, grassy, with some citrus and a hint of a sour aroma.  Taste is more grassy hops, some yeast, earthy malts.  Finishes short and crisp, medium bitterness fading into a more earthy aftertaste.  Great surprise for a bottle I picked out completely at random - a thoroughly tasty and enjoyable beer.

On tap. Straw/wheat color, slightly cloudy. Very refreshing beer, good carbonation, grassy hops, very slight sweetness, lingering grain on the finish. Really nice flavor and complexity for the style, very drinkable. Well done.

Golden pour with a short white head.  Herbal hops on the aroma, but the nose was mostly dominated by a metallic, rancid nuts.  The flavor was less dominated by that trait, with bready, biscuity malt become apparant, grassy, floral hops crisply finishing it out.  Refreshing moderately white body.  I wish I could stop tasting this funky off flavor in most of the lagers I try.

12 oz. Thanks ben! Pours crystal clear pale gold. Loose white film. Nice earthy leafy grassy nose. Crisp lightish body. Earthy grassy mid palate. Long grassy finish. A little crackery. Refreshing and delicious.
Nice sweet grassy nose, bready and fresh. Pours hazy light golden, fizzy white ring around the edges. Clean and grassy, light lemon, bread. Nice carb, very drinkable and refreshing.

In between straw yellow and pale golden with light white head .... aroma of sweet malt and floral hops light lacing ....  taste of sweet malts, light lemon, little grassy and floral hops smooth and easy drinking with a nice bitter floral hop finish .... really enjoyable pils

12 oz bottle.  Per their website this uses the Hallertauer Tradition hop variety.  Clear straw with a snowy white head.  Nose is dough, lemon and marjoram.  Crisp and creamy with quenching carb.  Taste is lemon peel, honey and grass.  Finishes slightly bitter with hints of pine.  Simple but well executed.

On tap, Als of Hampden.  Clear light yellow body with a small fizzy bright white head that fell to a thin covering.  Great fresh hop aroma with light and airy bready pils malt.  A little grassy, a little floral.  Nice crisp floral hops grab you up front, fading to a nicely bitter, softly malty finish.  Mouthfeel is light and airy with just the slightest doughy clinginess on the finish.  This was pretty awesome!  Going to have to try some bottles now.
Bottled.  Poured a mildly cloudy gold but less gold than Id expect.  Grassy with some hops to finish, more pilsnery than i expected.

IBG Summer Fest. Poured hazy amber with a large creamy white head that was lasting with good lacing. Good floral hop aroma. Medium body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Well balanced hop bitter sweet flavor with a medium bitter finish of moderate duration.

12oz bottle. Rating #54. Pale yellow color with a white head. Light sweet grain aroma, light pepper spiciness, a little grassy and very nice. Smooth, light hops and nice carbonation and more light malts, but with a nice big flavor, real nice stuff, wouldnt mind having this available as an everyday drinker. (1342)
user_location: Redlands, by way of Wisconsin,, California, USA

text: 12oz bottle, thanks egajdzis.  Medium white head atop lightly hazed straw body.  Aroma is medium sweet, straw/hay, light biscuit.  Taste is medium sweet, straw/grass, light biscuit.  Light, crisp, quite drinkable.
bottle. BCTC 2010. pale straw yellow pour. nice combination of the dry crispness of the pils & fruitiness of a keller. floral notes, dry, light pepper, crisp. very nice pils

Pours light gold into a shaker. Bright white head with medium retention recedes to skim surface. Sweet caramel and hop aromas. Soft yet crisp with slightly sour hay upfront turning peppery in the middle and on to a lasting dry bitter finish.

Tap at East Village Tavern, NYC. Pours a mostly clear, yellow-gold with a strong, fluffy white head. Pungent aroma, punctuated by a considerable hop presence. Flavor is lightly sweet with faint grass and grains, but mostly bitter. Light to medium in body with fine effervescence. Finishes extremely crisp and short. Really nice beer.

UPDATED: JUL 27, 2010 Hazy golden color with a medium sized white head that left nice lacing on the glass.  Aroma of citrus fruits, wet grains, toffee malts, and toast.  Taste of grass, citrus, toffee, toast, and a lightly bitter finish.

a bit thick and substantial in body with low carbonation and light golden color. appropriate hop character that is too strong and soapy like lye. what at first lingers, subsides except at the back of the palate where it is chalky. the beer is amped up but is it good? too one dimensional.

Pours a slightly hazy golden w a big white head... noble hop aroma, grassy, a touch of citrus, subtle biscuit... good hop, noble all the way through, decently dry in the finish, some bready malts in the back... very good...

Bottle from Pinnochios in Media.  Hazy yellow color with a nice white head.  Aroma is yeasty, taste is pilsener-esque - nicely hopped, citrusy, and refreshing.  This beer reminds me a bit of Sierra Nevada Summer.  Great brew overall - glad I found this one!

Fair pilsner, with a nice stinky saaz like aroma and flavor, a little musky, grassy and piney. Light palate, not as crisp as Id like, and fairly clean, not revealing any yeasty character like Id hoped. Hazy yellow, modest head.
Yellow, not much head.  Definite Pilsener aroma.  Taste is crisp, but with a pleasant, hoppy bitterness at the beginning of the finish.  A good, very drinkable beer.

Tap at Waterfront Ale House Manhattan: Pours a nice hazy light golden with a dense and well retained white head. Extremely clean dry aroma with crackery pils notes and a touch of noble hop vegetal notes. Lively yet creamy feel on the palate. Clean flavor throughout. Very very dry, with a firm crackery pils malt body, and a long peppery mild vegetal fresh noble hop bitterness. A fantastic pils that I can session all day.

I dont know if its because southampton is such a hoity-toity place that i automatically have a stigma against the brewery, but slowly but surely i am coming around after this and their double white. This was a snap decision buy before going to a party on july 4th, and it was such a hit that we had to go out and get another 3 six packs. Great flavor and color thats very refreshing on a hot day. this will probably get me into more of the southampton beers.

Fairly middle of the road. Tried it because they started brewing it at the old Rock brewery in Latrobe! Because they use different hops every year, this is one I will continue to try. This years batch had too much of a floral hop finish for me, but if you like that...

12oz bottle, purchased in PA. Pours a bright, effervescent, straw-golden color with just the slightest haze (surprised this isnt hazier); creamy, mixed-bubbled white head with excellent retention and lacing; solid-looking pour. Slightest amount of skunk at first, but this quickly dissipates; solid mineral and citrus bitterness in the aroma; very soft pils malt at the core, and generally clean; nicely hop-forward and quite crisp. Medium-light body; lively carbonation; lightly creamy presence in the mouth; the mineral and citrus bitterness is quite zesty; medium levels of hop bitterness and flavor; solid stuff; light Pils maltiness, showing hints of honey and a light graininess; pretty dry, nicely bitter and zesty, and (aside from the touch of skunk) quite clean and well-done. Tasty, modestly hoppy Pils; Id like to try this again, fresher. Medium finish: mineral bitterness, toastiness, nicely dry.
Had this one while I was camping.  Really dry and refreshing.  Lots of great hoppy goodness.  Fairly dry.  Id love to have this around all of the time.
From a bottle poured a golden color with a fair amount of head.  Nice bitter malty flavor with a lingering finish.

Finally an American brewed pils that I can really sink my teeth into. Its crisp grassy hops and clean finish bring you back again and again. So very refreshing which is my #1 criteria when downing a pils on a 95 degree evening. Think Ill stick with it all night.

Aroma is malty, grassy, crackery.  The appearance is gold, only lightly hazy (unexpected for an "unfiltered" beer, white head.  The flavor is grass, crackers.  The finish is noble hop bitterness.  The beer is medium in body, lots of carbonation.  Decent, not amazing by any means.  Of course, Im not a big fan of the style.  No obvoius defects, however.

On tap at the Publick House.  Pours a lightly hazed gold with a medium to large creamy white head.  Grainy and crackery, soft dusty wheat with a touch of lemon.  Medium bodied, crisp and smooth.  Nice crackery dry bitter finish.

Bottle.  Citrus and grass in the nose, dusty and dense, lightly foggy but has some bright punch to cut through it all.  Big score!  Very bright, very light yellow body, strong carbonation and a sudsy white head.  I love bright, super pale pilsners like this, though BJCP judges would knock it for being too light.  Taste is citric and grassy with medium-strong bitterness, very faint chalk.  Aftertaste is lightly bready and still bitter.  Lightish medium body with tons of carbonation and lingering crisp bubbling.  Soft water but a great bite!  Clean and smooth, perfectly repeatable summer pils.  A big fan of this one!

A very average representation of the style. Aroma was stale light malt with a definite citrus note. Pour was a light gold with a few bubbles and no head. Taste was very boring. Sticky light malt with not much going on. A slightly bitter grassy aftertaste that goes away quickly. Little carbonation. Nothing great and barely god.
user_location: Moon Twp, suburb of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Clean yeasty arom with no ill olfactory.   On the eye its clear pale yellow and lots of bubbles on the inside of the glass but no head. Sharp astringent killer peels flavor. Nice amount of crisp CO2. Finish is short sharp stronger pils bite.
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Bottle.  Pours a slight hazy golden straw color with a fluffy off-white head.  Aromas of light wheat and yeast, and mild grassy hops.  Flavor of mild spices, wheat, sour yeast, and a slightly bitter grassy finish.  Good.
12oz bottle.   Bright, clear yellow.  White foam.  Aroma of fruit and bread.  Hearty hop citrus, nice straw.  Nice fruity finish.  Great summer brew.
Clear grain aroma. Hazy light yellow color with a small white head. Light bitter beginning with a mild chewy palate finish.

12 ounce bottle from Superstar Huntington in Sam Adams lager glass.  Very pale hazy golden with lasting white head and lace.  Nice grassy lemon cake aroma with hint of pineapple.  Mild pineapple sweetness with assertive but not astringent or overbearing grassy lemony bitter hop clean finish.  Extremely clean, crisp and refreshing, without any off flavors.  Excellent.

Transparent gold, thick frothy white head. Nose has dusty hay, light lemon, some nice interplay with grass. Very grassy and dry flavor, lots of dirty malt in here and only the slightest kiss of hop through the earthy grass notes. The body is thicker than expected, and there is enough carbonation to keep it afloat but never muddling the malt.

On Tap at Mr. Beerys in Sarasota. Pours clear deep gold with white head. The aroma has spicy hops, a mild level of fresh corn and then heading into a thin layer of sweet malts at the end of the draw. The taste is similar pushing up some sharp spicy hops with floral hops around the edges and mild grainy malts and corn off in the background. Pretty refreshing brew.

Draft at redlight and fresh bottle. This pours a lightly hazy, golden yellow color topped by a smooth, off white head of foam that receds quickly to a thin film. The nose is pretty fresh showing hints of pine and floral hops, pepper spices, toasted bread malts, and some lager yeast. The flavor follows suit and is based in the yeasty, toasted bread malts and balanced perfectly by the fresh, crisp floral hops and spices that add a nice bitterness. There is also some grassy and lemon zest notes as well which enhance the clean, crispness. The mouthfeel is medium bodied with lively carbonation that leads to a clean, peppery finish. This is a great tasting and easy drinking pils.

Growler from Whole foods. Poured a light hazy yellow amber. Nose is a bit grassy and lemony.  Grassy and hoppy with a solid malt backbone. The finish has a nice bitter edge to it. Very drinkable, and very good.
Tap at Redlight. Light gold pour with a thick white head. Grassy noble gop aroma. Taste is crisp clean malt with a nice noble hop bite. Well done.

UPDATED: JUN 6, 2010 [Update - I tried the bottle version today for comparison, and the six packs are just as good as the draft version - it would seem that Phil has really hit his stride brewing on a larger scale] Growler from Big Z - pours a lightly hazy pale gold - soft, dry, herbal, grassy aroma - really wonderful and crisp - a bit of malt sweetness up front, followed by some light toasted graininess, but the star of the show here becomes the hops - dry, crisp, medium-bitter - malts become dry and crackery to compliment this - peppery, grassy finish - a fantastic pils.

A hyper clear straw colored body below a paper thin white head.  Nose is very corn & grainy, with an acidic/citrus sting of hops (or is it floral?), light and clean smelling.  A smooth, light-medium body (surprisingly), crispy clean mouthfeel and good, high carbonation.  A coriander, orange peel, Lemon twang accompanies a moderately bitter finish on this classic pilsner.

12oz. Bottle:  Aroma of pils malts, grains, cereal, and light hops.  Poured yellow in color with a tiny, white head around the edges.  Slightly hazy.  Lightly sparkling.  Flavor is medium to heavily bitter.  Tastes of pils malts, grains, grass, Saaz hops, and a hint of flowers.  Light to medium body.  Dry texture.  Average carbonation.  Pils malt, grain, and light saaz hop finish is bitter and dry.

Draft at Redlight Redlight.  The pour yields a lightly hazy, medium golden colored body.  From the base, a wide column of slowly cascading micro-bubble streams feed a small, smooth head of off-white foam.  Jagged, tattered lines of lacing scar the glass.  The nose is delectably fresh and crisp, showing notes of lightly toasted white bread, cracker, dry, softly-sweet dough, and a healthy balance of lightly peppery, floral hop character.  Flavors are the mirror image, again centered in excellently balanced, yeasty, bready dough as the malt base, with dry, crisp, spicy floral hops as the bittering counterpoint.  Theres a nice, grassy zestiness in there as well.  The palate sports a medium-light body with a softly lively carbonation, drinking as clean and crisp as just about any American made pilsener that I can recall.  This is an excellent session beer.  I could easily drink a boot of this stuff.

16 ounce pint - $6.00 at Taco Mac in Kennesaw, Georgia.

Appearance: Served up a clear, yellow body with a finger-high cap of white suds and the standard laceworks on the way down.

Smell: Pils malt with a delicate graininess to it and hop scnets of sliced lemon, unidentified spices, and distant cut grasses.

Taste: Minimal sweetness from the pilsner malts. Slightly chalky, grainy dough character. Light lemon rind fruitiness. Grassy, spicy noble Hallertau hops with a good degree of complimentary bitterness. Lil squeak of acidity. Dry, grassy finish.

Mouthfeel: Medium-light body. Medium carbonation.

Drinkability: A good, quality pils and a refreshing way to beat the heat here in miserable, muggy ole Georgia.

Draft at redlight redlight.  This is about as good as it gets for a Keller in America.  Crisp, packing full flavor and delicious.  Grain, corn and some dried grasses in the aroma.  Nobel hops through the palate.  Great beer.

From a 12oz bottle into a pilsner glass.  Pours yellow clear with a moderate amount of head.  I thought these werent supposed to be unfiltered?  This one certainly seemed crystal clear.  Aroma of honey and mild hops, a little skunk too.  Taste is smooth and crisp with a tiny amount of hops... I was hoping for a little bit more.  A little skunk and some grass round it out.  A very solid pilsner and worth drinking.

Bottle. Light golden color with a decent size white head. Yeasty aromas as well as malty and slight fruitiness. Flavor is yeasty, kinda earthy, citrus with a nice dry & bitter hop finish. Light/Medium bodied and easy drinking.
Bottle (newly  bottled, called Keller Pils) at Beerapalooza.  Hazy gold pour with nose of Saaz hops, citrus, bready pale malt.  Smooth, crisp, well balanced, and a nice beer.
Pours a clear golden color with a white head. Aroma is honey, vanilla, spicy, and herbal. Flavor is honey, grain, toast, and a bitter herbal finish.

draft @ redlight redlight.  Grassy hops, earthy, yeasty with some bread notes.  Pours blonde with a thick head.  Grassy hops with an earthy bitterness and hints of citrus, hay notes and bready malts in the flavor.  A very meaty pilsner.  Great session beer!

#3 Yall, 12 oz. bottle
Appearance:  Pours a semi cloudy, pastel yellow gold. Within the body, you will see noticeable rising carbonation, and sitting atop is a dense foamy white head.

Aroma:  Fresh cut straw, Eurohops and a little bit of yeasty bread notes.

Taste:  An even mixture of bread crust and spicy hops,husky grain, followed by metallic notes finishing with bitterness a sour twang.

Mouthfeel: Crisp, refreshing.

Overall:  A great summer drinker with some character. The hops really shined in this fresh beer.
Hey, it looks like me and Adrian are the first 2 to rate this.  Thanks, Adrian.  Toasty, yeasty aroma.  A dry, bready pilsner, that tickles the palate.  Very nice, snappy brew.

12 oz bottle.  Pours a clear yellow liquid gold with a small white head.  Aroma of bitterness, grains and yeast.  Taste is bitter with notes of grains, yeast and light lemon.  A refreshing warm day brew.

Rating #500.  Tap at SPH.  Pours your normal clear gold with a slight but fluffy white head.  Aroma was slight floral hop with a nice malt and grain crispness noticeable as well.  Taste is wheat and grain up front with a malty and slight floral hop backbone to it.  The beer remains smooth, crisp, and drinkable throughout, and I think it was a wonderful Pils.

On tap at SPH.  Pours a golden yellow, clear, with a slight white head.  Aroma of sweet malt and light fruits.  Flavor has a nice wheat base with a sweet fruity background.  I got lots of blueberries in it.  Palate is a bit weak, but overall, a nice sweet beer.

On tap at the Publick House. Not at all hazy/cloudy as the case with other locations. Grassy, grainy, mildly spicy aroma, a bit harsh all around. Flavor starts off in the same harsh manner, but after a bit some mildly acidic fruit shows its face and the graininess turns into more pleasant wheat. The hop character remained oddly abrasive in terms of meshing with the other flavors. Admittedly my first of the style (and of the three grouped styles), but just didnt do it for me.

Draught at Petes Waterfront.  Standard gold color, silightly hazy, with a little foamy white head.  Fresh grass and lemony aroma.  Light cereal malt and lemony/underripe orange hop flavors with some flower nectar/honey notes throughout.  Tame but noticeable hoppy bitterness on the finish.  Pleasantly off-sweet and nicely balanced.  Light to medium bodied and exceptionally drinkable without any thinness or wateriness.  Pretty nice.

on tap at the Blind Tiger.  Very hazy yellow in color, I actually thought this was the double white when I saw people drinking it.  Aroma is bready yeast, grainy pils malt, and lightly sweet.  Taste is bready and light to moderately hoppy.  Pretty enjoyable, seriously unfiltered pils.

UPDATED: SEP 2, 2010 12 oz bottle. Pours a hazed golden with a fluffy white head- lasting the whole way- leaving tons of streaky lace.  Aroma is toasty bread, light cracker, moderately solid pils malt, light dough and light grassy herbal german hops.  Flavor is soft and mostly delicate, with a doughy yeasty bread character, yet still crisp and nice herbal light grassy hop and mineral finish and very smooth.  I think the 12 oz bottles are even better than the 3 times I had it on tap this summer.  Pretty good price on the 6-packs means Ill probably continue to buy this as long as it stays fresh.  Mostly surprised at how good this is coming from latrobe!  Lion and Saratoga contracted SH always came up short for me.  
 
2007 rating:
Tap at Blind Tiger.  Pours a hazy dirty yeasty dull yellow with a fluffy white head that fades a bit.  Aroma is doughy, yeasty, a bit of sulfur left over from fermentation, earth and nice pils bready maltiness.  More dough and yeast flavor with hints of earthy hops, light citrus, and some spice.  Ok bitterness, and fairly smooth.  I prefer the Triumph keller to this one, but still good.

on tap at the Blind Tiger for the Southampton event May 23rd.  very cloudy chalky yellow color with a tall fluffy white head.  aroma is yeast wheat malt, a little earthy and candi sugar, wet cigarettes.  flavor is wet hay dryish malt, a little earthy and damp cigarettes.  sweet candi sugar malt is there and balances out, a bit of sweet malt finish.

On tap at the SPH.  Arrived at the table a crystal clear medium gold with a thin white ring that left farily nice lacing down the glass.  Llight aroma of yeast and slightly woody.  The flavor was very refreshing with some yeast, some biscuit flavors, and moderate hoppiness.  I paired two pints of this beer with the Cajun Tuna special and enjoyed both very much.
